name: NSRulerMarker
desc: A symbol on a ruler view, indicating a location for the graphics element it represents in the client of the ruler view.

items.name: init(rulerView: NSRulerView, markerLocation: CGFloat, image: NSImage, imageOrigin: NSPoint)
items.desc: Initializes a newly allocated ruler marker, associating it with (but not adding it to) a specified ruler view and assigning the attributes provided.

items.name: var imageOrigin: NSPoint
items.desc: The point in the receiver’s image that is positioned at the receiver’s location on the ruler view.

items.name: var imageRectInRuler: NSRect
items.desc: The rectangle occupied by the receiver’s image.

items.name: var thicknessRequiredInRuler: CGFloat
items.desc: The amount of the receiver’s image that’s displayed above or to the left of the ruler view's baseline.

items.name: var isMovable: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean that indicates whether the user can move the receiver in its ruler view.

items.name: var isRemovable: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean that indicates whether the user can remove the receiver from its ruler view.

items.name: var markerLocation: CGFloat
items.desc: The location of the receiver in the coordinate system of the ruler view's client view.

items.name: func draw(NSRect)
items.desc: Draws the receiver’s image that appears in the supplied rectangle.

items.name: var isDragging: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean that indicates whether the receiver is being dragged.

items.name: func trackMouse(with: NSEvent, adding: Bool) -> Bool
items.desc: Handles user manipulation of the receiver in its ruler view.
